private_information: I am allowed to move disks: A, B, C, D, E (A is smallest, E is largest of my set).
I can perform primitive moves of single top disks between pegs subject to Tower of Hanoi rules.
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves so that final configuration is: left (top→bottom) B, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle (top→bottom) C; right (top→bottom) A.

private_information: I am allowed to move disks: F, G, H, I, J.
I can perform primitive moves of single top disks between pegs subject to Tower of Hanoi rules.
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves so that final configuration is: left (top→bottom) B, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle (top→bottom) C; right (top→bottom) A.

private_information: I am allowed to move disks: K, L, M, N, O.
I can perform primitive moves of single top disks between pegs subject to Tower of Hanoi rules.
agent_3.goal: Contribute moves so that final configuration is: left (top→bottom) B, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle (top→bottom) C; right (top→bottom) A.

private_information: I coordinate agent move outputs and must assemble a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward planner.
I must keep agent actions distinct and validate all primitive moves respect Tower of Hanoi rules and agent disk permissions.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent move lists into a correct multi-agent plan and produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownward. Also present a consolidated ordered list of primitive moves in the required textual format.

public_information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi variant with 15 labeled disks (A smallest, O largest).
Legal primitive move: move the top disk from one peg to another only if that disk is smaller than any disk at destination peg's top (or destination is empty).
Initial configuration (left peg top→bottom): A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
Goal configuration: left peg (top→bottom) B, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg (top→bottom) C; right peg (top→bottom) A.
Agents are constrained: agent_1 may move only A,B,C,D,E; agent_2 may move only F,G,H,I,J; agent_3 may move only K,L,M,N,O.
All agents must respect the Tower of Hanoi movement rules and their disk permissions.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You are permitted to move only disks A, B, C, D, E. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves you will perform. Each primitive move must be in the format exactly: 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Ensure every move respects Tower of Hanoi rules (only move top disks; cannot place larger on smaller) and your permission set. Do not emit PDDL.

You are agent_2. You are permitted to move only disks F, G, H, I, J. Provide any primitive moves you must perform in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If no moves are necessary, return 'no_moves'. Do not emit PDDL.

You are agent_3. You are permitted to move only disks K, L, M, N, O. Provide any primitive moves you must perform in the format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If no moves are necessary, return 'no_moves'. Do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the agents' move lists into a consistent multi-agent plan and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownward planner. Keep agent actions distinct (prefix action names or predicates with agent identifiers if necessary). Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Also produce a consolidated ordered list of primitive moves in the exact textual format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Validate all moves respect Tower of Hanoi rules and agent disk permissions.

reference_solution: agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk C from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk B from right to left
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
